headline.main: Frenzied Hours for U.S. on the Fate of a China Insider

docs.snippet: It was the evening of Feb. 6 when a famous Chinese crime fighter showed up at the U.S. Consulate in Chengdu. He was seeking asylum with the Americans, telling a tale of corruption, international intrigue and murder that seemed to implicate a membe...
docs.abstract: It was the evening of Feb. 6 when a famous Chinese crime fighter showed up at the U.S. Consulate in Chengdu. He was seeking asylum with the Americans, telling a tale of corruption, international intrigue and murder that seemed to implicate a member of the Politburo. A Chinese security squad arrived and surrounded the consulate. Inside, anxious U.S. diplomats called the White House. Then things got really interesting.

headline.name: Cannoli Cream Calzone With Honey and Orange
headline.main: See You Later, Pizza, This Dough Is for Calzones

docs.snippet: A calzone has many of the perks of pizza. Easy and crowd pleasing, it’s a good vehicle for using up odds and ends in the fridge. Taking a cue from Lucali’s Nutella-drizzled calzone, I attempted my own dessert version. I mixed honey, cinnamon a...

multimedia.credit: Andrew Scrivani for The New York Times
Andrew Scrivani for The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: A calzone has many of the perks of pizza. Easy and crowd pleasing, it’s a good vehicle for using up odds and ends in the fridge. Taking a cue from Lucali’s Nutella-drizzled calzone, I attempted my own dessert version. I mixed honey, cinnamon and orange zest into ricotta before filling the pizza dough (the same one used for a savory calzone), then I dusted the top with powdered sugar after baking. A sprinkle of sea salt lent a savory contrast to this most sweet endeavor.
